trans-unit.source: Specifies the dimensions of the margins of a printed page.
The Margins class is used to manipulate the width of margins in <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintController>.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.MarginsConverter> is the type descriptor for this class.

<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Left%2A>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Right%2A>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Top%2A>, and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Bottom%2A> are properties that define the margins.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Clone%2A> creates an identical Margins.
<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Equals%2A> determines if another object has the same dimensions as a Margins.
For more information about printing, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref> class with 1-inch wide margins.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref> class with the specified left, right, top, and bottom margins.
The left margin, in hundredths of an inch.
The right margin, in hundredths of an inch.
The top margin, in hundredths of an inch.
The bottom margin, in hundredths of an inch.
The left parameter value is less than 0.
-or- The right parameter value is less than 0.
-or- The top parameter value is less than 0.
-or- The bottom parameter value is less than 0.
Gets or sets the bottom margin, in hundredths of an inch.
If you measure margins in millimeters, multiply the margin width you want in millimeters by 3.937 to determine the correct measurement in hundredths of an inch.
For example, if you want a margin of 25mm, multiply by 3.937 and the result is 98 when rounded down.
You would then set the appropriate <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins> member to 98.
The bottom margin, in hundredths of an inch.
The Bottom property is set to a value that is less than 0.
Retrieves a duplicate of this object, member by member.
A duplicate of this object.
Compares this <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref> to the specified <xref:System.Object> to determine whether they have the same dimensions.
The object to which to compare this <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified object is a <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref> and has the same <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Top*>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Bottom*>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Right*> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Left*> values as this <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Calculates and retrieves a hash code based on the width of the left, right, top, and bottom margins.
A hash code based on the left, right, top, and bottom margins.
Gets or sets the left margin width, in hundredths of an inch.
If you measure margins in millimeters, multiply the margin width you want in millimeters by 3.937 to determine the correct measurement in hundredths of an inch.
For example, if you want a margin of 25mm, multiply by 3.937 and the result is 98 when rounded down.
You would then set the appropriate <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins> member to 98.
The left margin width, in hundredths of an inch.
The Left property is set to a value that is less than 0.
Compares two <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref> to determine if they have the same dimensions.
The first <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref> to compare for equality.
The second <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref> to compare for equality.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Left*>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Right*>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Top*>, and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Bottom*> properties of both margins have the same value; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Compares two <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref> to determine whether they are of unequal width.
The first <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref> to compare for inequality.
The second <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref> to compare for inequality.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate if the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Left*>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Right*>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Top*>, or <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins.Bottom*> properties of both margins are not equal; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the right margin width, in hundredths of an inch.
If you measure margins in millimeters, multiply the margin width you want in millimeters by 3.937 to determine the correct measurement in hundredths of an inch.
For example, if you want a margin of 25mm, multiply by 3.937 and the result is 98 rounded down.
You would then set the appropriate <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins> member to 98.
The right margin width, in hundredths of an inch.
The Right property is set to a value that is less than 0.
Gets or sets the top margin width, in hundredths of an inch.
If you measure margins in millimeters, multiply the margin width you want in millimeters by 3.937 to determine correct measurement in hundredths of an inch.
For example, if you want a margin of 25mm, multiply by 3.937 and the result is 98 when rounded down.
You would then set the appropriate <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Margins> member to 98.
The top margin width, in hundredths of an inch.
The Top property is set to a value that is less than 0.
Converts the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref> to a string.
A <xref:System.String> representation of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Margins"></xref>.
